title: Kate Hudson opens up about living a healthy lifestyle and maintaining her weight
text:
She became a global ambassador for WW - formerly known as Weight Watchers - in 2018.

And now, Kate Hudson has opened up maintaining her weight and living a balanced lifestyle after giving birth to her third child last year.

Speaking to The Sun Herald, the 40-year-old actress said: 'It's about understanding your food and maintaining a healthy lifestyle, being part of a community and having support.'

'It's about understanding your food': Kate Hudson (pictured) has opened up maintaining her weight and living a balanced lifestyle after giving birth to her third child last year in an interview with The Sun Herald on Sunday

Kate explained that she also eats healthy meals and makes informed decisions when it comes to food.

She said that it's not just about losing weight but more about wellness.

'I've always been a very healthy eater and I'm very knowledgeable about nutrition but I use the app to look things up that I'm not sure about.'

Kate said: 'It's about understanding your food and maintaining a healthy lifestyle, being part of a community and having support'

Meanwhile, Kate was announced as a global ambassador for WW in December last year - two months after giving birth to her third child.

Speaking to PEOPLE at the time, she said 'it came at a perfect time' because it gave her the opportunity to focus on herself.

'It's hard when you have babies. Everyone comes before you, and you have to find that time to just focus in on yourself,' she told the publication.

Choices: Kate explained that she also eats healthy meals and makes informed decisions when it comes to food

'One of my passions in life is wanting people to live their most optimum life, whether it be in health or in happiness,' she said.

She said that as an ambassador she hopes to inspire others to live a more balanced and healthier lifestyle.

'I am excited to walk down a street and have someone come up and say they're apart of the community, because it means they're doing something good for themselves.'

authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
